Miniatures.title: Barbarian
Miniatures.description: The barbarian, the greatest warrior of all. But beware of magic for your sword is no defence against it.

Miniatures.title: Dwarf
Miniatures.description: A good warrior and has the unique ability to disarm traps without a tool kit. To do so, a black shiled must be avoided whilst rolling a combat die.

Miniatures.title: Wizard
Miniatures.description: You have the ability to cast many different spells. However, you cannot wear armour or use large weapons. Therefore, you must cast your spells wisely and avoid physical combat where you are weak.

Miniatures.title: Elf
Miniatures.description: A master of both magic and the sword. Yu must use both well if you are to triumph. You have the power to cast three magical spells, all relating to one element.

Miniatures.title: Goblin
Miniatures.description: These green-skinned creatures are small and quick. Despite their stature and lack of brute strength, they are dangerous foes..

Miniatures.title: Orc
Miniatures.description: Orcs are related to goblins but are larger and much more powerful. They form the rank and file of Zargon's armies. Those who are allied with the evil sorcerer are fierce and deadly warriors who should never be underestimated.

Miniatures.title: Abomination
Miniatures.description: Little is known of these monsters. The hulking amphibious humanoids are used by Zargon to enforce his tyranny and are quite dangerous even when encountered individually.

Miniatures.title: Dread Warriors
Miniatures.description: These humans have become monster-minions of darkness. They are always heavily armoured and oftern bear weapons enchanted with Dread magic. These Derad warriors strike fear into all but the bravest (or most foolish) of opponents.

Miniatures.title: Skeletons
Miniatures.description: The animated remains of long dead warriors, skeletons form the bulk of the armies of the undead. They are slow but relentless, controlled by Dread magic.

Miniatures.title: Zombies
Miniatures.description: Like Skeletons, zombies are magically animated corpses. Unlike skeletons, some still beartraces of decaying flesh and muscle. Their movements are slow and awkward, and they carry the stench of the grave wherever they go.

Miniatures.title: Mummies
Miniatures.description: Embalmed and preserved by secret and magical arts, mummies are controlled by a more powerful version of the magic that animates zombies and skeletons. They are very hard to overcome in single-handed combat.

Miniatures.title: Gargoyle
Miniatures.description: These foul creatures are also produced by Dread magic. In essence, they are stone satues of great monsters, brought to life through arcane rituals. Their stone skin makes them very hard to wound in combat.

Miniatures.title: Dread Sorcerer
Miniatures.description: This figure will be used as several different characters (both good and bad) in various quests

Miniatures.title: Knight
Miniatures.description: The Knight is one of the Classes in Dark Souls. The Knight is a tank class, and starts with the highest vitality value of all classes, as well as possessing the most robust equipment.

Miniatures.title: Warrior
Miniatures.description: The Warrior is one of the most well-rounded starting classes, with high Strength and Dexterity, allowing them to make use of a lot of the equipment they come across. They also start with a solid shield and an easy-to-use weapon, as well as fairly light armor that sacrifices Poise for mobility.

Miniatures.title: Herald
Miniatures.description: The Herald is one of ten starting Classes in Dark Souls 3. This class is a bit more well-rounded than the pure melee styles of the Knight and Warrior, instead dipping into faith to backup their attack with a bit of healing magic. A former herald who journeyed to finish a quest undertaken.

Miniatures.title: Assassin
Miniatures.description: The Assassin is one of ten starting Classes in Dark Souls 3. This class mixes the sneaky fighting style of the Thief with a bit of magic to augment indirect combat. An assassin who stalks their prey from the shadows. Favors sorceries in addition to thrusting swords.

Miniatures.title: Hollow Soldier
Miniatures.description: Undead Soldiers that wield crossbows are often positioned in out-of-the-way locations (usually on high ground) and act as a support class to the melee-focused Soldiers. When approached, they will either retreat and continue shooting, or draw a sword and act as a shieldless sword-wielder.

Miniatures.title: Crossbow Hollow
Miniatures.description: Undead Soldiers that wield crossbows are often positioned in out-of-the-way locations (usually on high ground) and act as a support class to the melee-focused Soldiers. When approached, they will either retreat and continue shooting, or draw a sword and act as a shieldless sword-wielder.

Miniatures.title: Large Hollow
Miniatures.description: The Large Hollow Soldier first targets the nearest character. If two or more characters are tied for being nearest to him, then he targets whichever one of them has the aggro token. If none of them have the aggro token, he targets the one with the highest taunt value.

Miniatures.title: Silver Knight Swordsman
Miniatures.description: The Silver Knight Straight Sword is a straight sword in Dark Souls. The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon. Its chain attacks, in which the wielder takes great advancing steps and makes use of his bodyweight, are deadly even in single hits.

Miniatures.title: Silver Knight Greatbowman
Miniatures.description: The Silver Knight Straight Sword is a straight sword in Dark Souls. The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon. Its chain attacks, in which the wielder takes great advancing steps and makes use of his bodyweight, are deadly even in single hits.

Miniatures.title: Gargoyle
Miniatures.description: The Bell Gargoyles is one of the Bosses found in Dark Souls. This Boss can be found in the Undead Parish. Although at first it may seem as if there's just one foe to fight up on the roof of Undead Parish, about halfway through the battle a second Bell Gargoyle will join the skirmish, making things even trickier.

Miniatures.title: Titanite Demon
Miniatures.description: The Titanite Demon, also referred to as Prowling Demon or Faceless Demon, is an intimidating foe that often guards valuable items or important areas in Dark Souls. It is also one of the few sources of rare Demon Titanite used for weapon upgrades. In melee, it attacks by swinging its Titanite Catch Pole.

Miniatures.title: Dancer of the Boreal Valley
Miniatures.description: The Dancer is a towering, lanky being that more closely resembles her master, Pontiff Sulyvahn, than the other beastly armored knights from Irithyll, like Vordt. She stands upright instead of crawling on all fours and shambles with deceivingly slow steps.

Miniatures.title: Winged Knight
Miniatures.description: Weak to Frostbite, Dark Damage, Magic Damage and Thrust Damage. Resistant to most types of damages, Poison/Toxic and Bleed. Twin-Axe version can be parried and riposted. Can be lured.

Miniatures.title: Boreal Outrider Knight
Miniatures.description: A powerful knight that serves as a mini-boss. One can be found before the first Road of Sacrifices bonfire. Just take the elevator all the way down. This one drops the Irithyll Straight Sword.

Miniatures.title: Dragon Slayer Ornstein
Miniatures.description: Dragon Slayer Ornstein is a member of the Four Knights of Gwyn, an elite personal guard to Lord Gwyn, the primary god of the Dark Souls universe. Loyal to Gwyn since the dawn of the Age of Fire, he has an elemental affinity with lightning, which he used to slay dragons using his cross spear weapon.

Miniatures.title: Sentinels
Miniatures.description: Giant guardians of Anor Londo. Sentinels wear the Giant Set and wield the Giant's Halberd and Giant Shield. They are highly susceptible to Poison; three Poison Arrows is sufficient to kill them, enabling the player to hit them at a safe distance and simply wait for them to die.

Miniatures.title: Executioner Smough
Miniatures.description: The royal executioner of Anor Londo, Smough was an antagonistic and cruel individual who enjoyed grinding the bones of his victims and using it as seasoning for his meals. Although he had the strength and skills to compete with the Four Knights of Gwyn, he was rejected for his sadistic and cannibalistic tendencies.

Miniatures.title: Clan Wren
Miniatures.description: An ancient Mandalorian clan with ties to House Vizsla, Clan Wren's storied warriors are legendary for their battlefield prowess. Now they unite with the Rebellion, fighting for a free galaxy and the liberation of Mandalore.
